definition: to sacrifice oneself in a just cause/a victim of a disaster
to be buried with the dead/to die for a cause

sentences.english: There was no martyrdom video of the kind favoured by Hamas.
sentences.chinese: 他没有哈马斯喜欢搞的那种殉难视频。

sentences.english: They have suffered for the country.
In this place there are no martyrdoms.
sentences.chinese: 在这个地方，不存在烈士殉难问题。

sentences.english: Only researching on the mistakes of historians' records of Xiaoru's martyrdom could the historical reality be represented.
sentences.chinese: 考证史家曲笔与错误之处，才能再现孝孺殉难的真相。

sentences.english: The path of Christianity has always been lit by the light of burning martyrs .
sentences.chinese: 基督徒的道路已经被烈火中的殉难者的光芒照亮。

sentences.english: Martyrdom Week marks the anniversary of the assassination of Maulvi Muhammad Farooq, a figure in the Kashmir separatist movement.
sentences.chinese: 殉难周是为了纪念克什米尔分裂运动成员法鲁克遇害。

sentences.english: Martyrdom is sublimation, corrosive sublimation. It is a torture which consecrates.
sentences.chinese: 殉难者有高尚的品德，一种腐蚀性的高尚。

sentences.english: I was praying to the martyr there on high.
sentences.chinese: 我为天上的那位殉难者祈祷。

sentences.english: Where will all the martyrs go when the virus cures itself?
sentences.chinese: 当病毒治愈着它自己时，所有那些殉难者何去何从？

definition: to meet with disaster/killed/in the clutches of the enemy/to fall foul of/in danger
to die in an accident/to die for a just cause
to sacrifice one's life by loyalty (to one's prince, one's husband etc)
to die for a just cause
to die in an accident or disaster/to be killed
to die in the line of duty
to vow to fight to the death
